title: The best gifts for men: 64 awesome options for every type of guy
description: Whether he likes camping, the latest tech, comfy athleisure, or sparkly jewelry, we've got gifts for men he's sure to love.
excerpt: Don't know what to get the greatest guy you know? We have some suggestions.
text: Don't know what to get the greatest guy you know? We have some suggestions. Editors and writers independently select products unless marked Sponsored or Promoted. Sponsored content is a paid ad, while content marked Promoted is chosen by Ziff Davis leadership. We may earn an affiliate commission if you buy through our links. Promoted cards do not include input from individual authors. Remember: The best gifts for men should make the guy you're buying for feel seen. They should make him feel like you truly get him.No two guys are the same, and not every man spends their days dreaming of whiskey stones. (In fact, we'd guess that very few of them do.) Traditional male stereotypes are a thing of the past, y'all, and it's time we started embracing that fact when we're looking for gifts. Before you click “buy” on something that will definitely require a gift receipt, let us take the wheel and show you some gifts for him that are sure to make an impression on your lucky guy. And if you need more specific gift ideas, check out this gift guide for the father figure in your life, or this one if you’re shopping for your boyfriend. Whether he’s into kitchen accessories, fashion-forward athleisure, self-care products, or something more eccentric, we’re confident that he'll love the picks on this list. For Father's Day birthdays, holidays, and any random occasion, we've got you covered. A high-lumen flashlight Best for the safety chief You may have seen those TikTok videos of super-bright flashlights that turn night into day. And if you haven't, we bet the man you're shopping for has. This compact flashlight somehow packs 1,200 lumens of light, and you may want to remind him not to point it directly at anyone's face. SPONSORED NOW StreamSaver™ from Xfinity Best for the pop culture expert For the dude who can't miss a single moment of his favorite shows, add a NOW TV entertainment package to his Xfinity subscription. He'll be able to stream more than 125 live TV channels (including the History Channel, Food Network, Discovery, and Animal Planet, to name a few.) Included with this deal is a Peacock Premium subscription and the ability to simultaneously stream on up to three devices at once. A dad-approved battery caddy Best for going full dad-mode For dads, or guys who are slowly turning into their dads, this gift idea will give him ultimate DIY-cred. This battery storage caddy is named — we kid you not — the Battery Daddy, and it lets him play the hero every time a remote control or flashlight runs out of juice. (It even comes with a battery tester.) Pair this with a battery multi-pack for extra gifting points. A Nintendo Switch OLED Best for the on-the-go gamer If he's a gamer and doesn't have a Nintendo Switch yet, it's time to rectify that problem. And why not do it with the best iteration of the handheld console yet? It's got a new and improved OLED screen (it's bigger than ever, too), better speakers, more storage, and plenty more to go ga-ga over. A high-tech air purifier Best for the wellness nut This super sleek and quiet purification system for air and exposed surfaces eliminates pathogens, bacteria, germs, mold, and viruses, and is easy to install on a ceiling, wall, or floor, so he can breathe easy. Available in three different power options for different square footage areas, its compact size equals a low carbon footprint and low energy consumption. SPONSORED Smart Garage® Video Keypad from MyQ Best for the responsible one The humble garage door opener is getting an upgrade. This smart model from MyQ allows you to create unique PINs on the app for family members and guests, monitor activity via a security camera, and receive real-time alerts. For a limited time, you can also snag it on sale for $49.99. A handsome wine rack Best for the oenophile This unique wine rack holds up to six bottles of wine (larger sizes are available), and it's just the right size to keep on your countertops. From now on, he'll always have a bottle of wine close at hand, and he can show off his latest bottles whenever guests visit. SPONSORED Peloton Tread Best for the guy who's gotta move If he loves to run, but gets demotivated once the cold sets in, then the Peloton Tread is likely at the top of his list. This is way more than an indoor treadmill. An all-access membership lets him tune into live and on-demand classes (yoga, strength training, etc) plus he can also stream movies and TV shows to make those long runs a bit more bearable. For a limited time, get up to $800 off Peloton Tread packages. A laser-guided robot vacuum Best for clean freaks This robot vacuum may have an intimidating price tag, but we have good news: It's pretty much always on sale for at least $150 off. For the Type A guys in your life who absolutely hate the sight of pet hair or dust bunnies, this smart robot vacuum uses lasers to hunt down dirt. A Lego set for adults Best for brick builders There's a lot of crossover between gamers and Lego fans. This fierce little Piranha Plant kit from the Lego Super Mario collection will not only be fun to build, but will also give him a fun new piece of decor for his desk or bookshelf. A pair of Bowflex SelectTech 552 adjustable dumbbells Best for the guy with a home gym Not everyone has time to go to a gym, so the next best thing is making the gym right where you are. While pricey, the Bowflex SelectTech 552 adjustable dumbbells are the epitome of "bang for your buck" — in one pair of dumbbells, you'll basically get an entire dumbbell rack that you'd typically find in a commercial gym, so it's a real space-saver. Time to get big! A 'Hot Ones' hot sauce bundle Best for the 'Hot Ones' fan If you've ever heard him say, "Damn, I wish that were me," while watching an episode of "Hot Ones," now is your opportunity to make that dream come true. This bundle includes every sauce from the latest season, including Heatonist's ultra-spicey house version of the fan-favorite, "Da Bomb." Interview questions and chicken wings not included. A Lodge enameled Dutch oven Best for the guy with too much cookware Are his pots and pans clattering to the floor every time he opens his kitchen cabinet? If so, he needs something a little more "all-in-one" so he can gain back some of that storage space. A Dutch oven is a versatile cookware essential that can last a lifetime if taken care of properly. This one from Lodge is extremely well-made, and doesn't cost nearly as much as its Le Creuset rival. A Polaroid Now+ Best for the photographer If he’s obsessed with documenting his life through pictures, he’ll certainly appreciate Polaroid’s latest (and most modern) instant camera to date. He can pair it with the Polaroid app via Bluetooth to get creative with Aperture, Tripod, Remote, Self-Timer, Light Painting, Double Exposure, Portrait, and Manual modes. It also comes with a bonus lens filter kit — throw in some spare film, and you'll be golden. Xbox Game Pass Ultimate Best for the gamer If the majority of his monthly expenses involve video games, Xbox Game Pass is a must. Basically the Netflix of gaming, Xbox Game Pass has an extended library of titles, including both new releases and classics, to download at any time. It's also suspiciously cheap for the value, but we aren't complaining.  A VNYL subscription Best for the music nerd If his Spotify membership isn't doing it for him, treat him to a vinyl subscription service. VNYL will send brand new records to members each month based on their personal music tastes, making it a wonderful way to discover obscure artists and your new favorite track. (Just make sure he has a record player, first.) A HyperChiller Best for iced coffee enthusiasts Who doesn’t love a good iced coffee? The HyperChiller is a delightful (and dishwasher-safe) beverage chiller that turns piping hot coffee into refreshing iced coffee in about a minute, and without diluting it. It also works for whiskey, bottles of wine, and tea.  The Courant Catch:3 wireless charging tray Best for the messy man If his nightstand is looking totally out of sorts, the Courant Catch:3 should get him back on track (though we can't speak for the rest of his room). It isn't just a catch-all tray for jewelry, keys, and other items of the like — it's also a wireless charging mat that works on any nightstand. The Byrd Hairdo Products Flock Favorites kit Best for guys who love their hair If his hair routine is an important part of his daily grooming ritual, Byrd makes a fantastic haircare set that covers the essentials. It comes with a canister of matte pomade, a texturizing salt spray, a pocket comb, and an air freshener as a fun little extra something.  The Bearaby Cotton Napper weighted blanket Best for the anxious guy Weighted blankets are all the rage right now, but what sets Bearaby's Napper apart is that it's fully hand-knit, which should help minimize bead leakage. It's also machine washable. Birkenstock Boston Clog Best for the guy who hates shoelaces Sometimes laces are nothing more than a chore. If he's most concerned with comfort, the Birkenstock Boston Clogs come with a form-fitting footbed that's excellent for extended wear. Plus, they're really popular on TikTok, so extra cool points for that. A Mejuri mini hoop earring Best for the guy who likes jewelry If he appreciates a little understated bling in his daily getup, these mini hoop earrings from Mejuri should complement his personal style nicely. They come in both white and yellow gold; we recommend picking up one of each for when he wants to switch things up. (They're true 14-karat gold, too, meaning they won't oxidize or discolor — a great value for $30.)   A pair of Carhartt double-front washed duck work pants Best for the guy who's on-trend Carhartt work pants have officially left the "dads only" category. These have a comfortable, loose fit that sits high on the waist, plenty of pockets, and cool knee-pad detailing on the front. Time to hop on the bandwagon.  The Brooklinen Super-Plush Robe Best for the homebody Every guy needs a good robe, by which we mean an investment that will last, not fall apart in the wash. Brooklinen's Super-Plush Robe will ensure that his homebody self is feeling comfortable and luxurious at all times. Plus, it's seriously soft. A Dodow sleep aid Best for the restless guy Not everyone sleeps like a baby. Some of us need a little extra help to catch some of those much-needed Zs. If you know a guy who has trouble getting to sleep at night, check out the Dodow sleep aid device: a metronome system designed to help you fall asleep naturally. A Menlo Club subscription Best for the fashion newbie If the man in your life has zero fashion sense, then a monthly subscription to Menlo Club makes a great gift. For $60 a month, subscribers will receive two or three curated items in the mail to keep, ranging from casual clothes like T-shirts and jeans to activewear like running shorts and tank tops. A Loot Crate subscription Best for geeky guys If the man in your life is a comic book nerd, a Loot Crate membership is a must-have. Once a month, the pop culture subscription service will send a mystery box full of products, toys, T-shirts, socks, and more right to his doorstep. The best part: Most of the items sent are exclusives or limited editions. A pour-over coffee maker Best for coffee lovers The Chemex Classic Series Pour-Over Glass Coffeemaker looks gorgeous on a countertop and makes for a lovely gift for even the snobbiest of coffee snobs. This option makes eight cups and can be refrigerated and reheated without the coffee getting gross. The Cubii under-desk elliptical Best for the multitasker If you've ever heard him complain that he simply doesn't have enough time to go to the gym, give him this creative way to multitask. The Cubii Under Desk Elliptical will allow him to work out while he's working — who needs an Equinox membership, anyway? A Hydro Flask Best for the hydrated dude One of the most popular insulated water bottles on the market, a Hydro Flask is one of the best ways to ensure that he stays hydrated in style. It's capable of keeping hot drinks hot for up to 12 hours, and cold drinks cold for an entire day. Plus, a wide opening and a straw lid allow for easy beverage access. Did we mention it's all dishwasher-safe? A Braun electric shaver Best for men who need a close shave If you know someone who wants to ditch their razor blades and shaving cream in favor of electric razors, the Braun Electric Shaver Series 9 should be at the top of your list. The Series 9 is a superb electric shaver that is also gentle on the face — two very important qualities. It's expensive, yes, but oh-so worth it. An Ember mug Best for the tea sipper Here's the tea: The Ember mug is a truly next-level product for any and all hot-beverage-drinking guys. Through Ember's app, he'll have the ability to select his preferred temperature, to which the mug will adjust on command. Just one charge will give the mug a whole hour of juice, and he can even save temperature presets for different types of drinks.  Amazon's favorite sous vide Best for the aspiring chef We're past the age of grilled steaks — it's all about sous vide nowadays. While it takes longer and is a more involved process, the result is dangerously delicious, which is why it's a great gift for the foodie fellas. This WiFi-enabled sous vide tool from Amazon best-seller Anova is one of the sleekest, most compact options out there, and it makes the process simple for newbies. The Awair Element Best for the health-conscious Maintaining a safe and healthy home starts with good air quality. Enter: the Awair Element, a modern-looking monitoring device that measures and tracks fine dust particles and any chemicals present in the air. He'll be able to access real-time data and personalized recommendations on its companion app, including insights on how his actions (like the cleaning supplies he uses) are impacting the health of his space. A Tooletries shower organizer Best for the disorganized dude Put an end to bathroom clutter and help him get his self-care life together with this shower organizer from Tooletries. It fits a toothbrush, razor, and all the little fixings that come along with them. Stick it anywhere in the shower and it's ready to go — you can even pick up the shower mirror from Tooletries and complete the set.  The Jack Black Skin Saviors set Best for the self-care obsessed Guys need a proper skincare routine, too, and this set from Jack Black (no, not that Jack Black) is a great start. It includes a daily facial cleanser, an energizing exfoliator, a double-duty moisturizer, and an intense therapy lip balm. Whether he needs a new routine or is already skincare-obsessed, this set is a great option. A 23andMe DNA test kit Best for the curious guy 23andMe is a super popular gift every year, in part due to its convenience. Once he gets the kit, all he'll need to do is send in a small sample of saliva to 23andMe. In roughly three to four weeks, he'll get a comprehensive report of his ancestry, including precise geographic detail and in-depth historical insights, as well as a breakdown of his defining genetic traits. A Kindle Paperwhite Best for the bookworm This thin, lightweight, and long-lasting e-reader has a glare-free display, which helps its screen look like real paper even in direct sunlight. It's waterproof, too, meaning he'll be able to take it out by the pool (or even on a beach trip), and an adjustable warm light keeps it easy on his eyes. Plus, it comes with a free four-month trial of Kindle Unlimited — in case he's already plowed through his library and needs something new to read. Ray-Ban Wayfarer sunglasses Best for the classic man These sunglasses are a timeless classic. If your recipient has some retro taste in fashion but still wants to keep his accessories trend-proof, these shades will help him achieve the effortless style he's looking for. They really look good with everything, from workout clothes to formalwear. Felix Gray glasses Best for dealing with eye strain If the man you're shopping for stares at a screen all day, snag him a pair of these stylish, blue light-blocking glasses to give his peepers some much-needed relief. They'll filter out the harmful blue-violet light rays commonly emitted from digital devices, which can lead to eye strain, headaches, and sleep disruption. A personalized cutting board Best for the culinary king Most people have a cutting board — but not a cutting board with their name literally carved into it. This handcrafted maple cutting board can be customized with up to 12 characters and will make a lovely accent piece in his kitchen. Add a bottle of mineral oil for $9 to help it last for years to come. A Tile Pro Bluetooth tracker Best for the forgetful man If he's the type of guy to leave his keys at home or his wallet in random coffee shops, the small but endlessly helpful Tile Pro is here to solve his problems. Simply attach one of the fobs to frequently misplaced items, then use the Tile app to locate them locate via smartphone. An Otterbox phone case Best for the clumsy guy Know a guy who's dropping his phone constantly? Get him an Otterbox case. This one is part of the "Commuter" series, and it's designed to handle whatever screen-shattering threats may come your guy's way. For the slightly ham-handed man in your life, this is perfect for everyday use.  A Yeti Rambler Colster Best for beer bros Let's be honest: No one likes room-temperature beer. Keep his brews nice and chilly with this Yeti Rambler Colster can insulator. The no-sweat design will keep his hands dry, while the load-and-lock gasket ensures his drink is tucked in securely. It's a fancy, attractive, and practical solution. A Google Nest Hub Best for the smart home lover Is his home decked out in smart devices, like Philips Hue bulbs and a Nest thermostat? The second-gen Google Nest Hub will serve as a one-stop shop for all of his smart device controls, making it much easier for him to interact with his fully connected home. Beyond that, he can also use it to catch up on his Netflix queue, listen to music, and even get a better night's sleep (with the help of its Sleep Sensing tool). A Theragun Mini Best for fitness fanatics After long runs or intense workouts, pretty much everyone wishes they could get a massage. The compact, quiet Theragun Mini is basically the next best thing. Even though it's small enough to toss in a bag, the powerful device will give him a good-enough muscle massage to kickstart his recovery. The FosPower solar hand crank portable radio Best for the outdoorsman He doesn’t play by the rules. Sure, some people sleep at campsites when they want a touch of nature. But not him. He’s going way off the beaten path. Help him stay safe while forging his own way through nature with this solar-powered, hand-crank portable radio/phone charger/lamp. Powerbeats Pro wireless earbuds Best for the runner Some people march to the beat of their own drum; others run to a heavy bass beat. No matter what he’s listening to while he's out pounding the pavement, these earbuds deliver excellent audio quality — and they won’t fall out no matter how much he moves.  A Ninja BL610 professional blender Best for the smoothie king If he’s constantly making smoothies, give him a gift he’ll actually use. This top-rated blender will whip up the smoothest drinks from fresh fruits and vegetables in seconds. (It also crushes ice and frozen fruit.) And if he’s not super into health drinks, tell him he's free to use it to make margaritas instead. A bike phone mount Best for the cyclist If his Trek is his main mode of transportation around town, he’ll appreciate a phone mount when he’s navigating to a new location. This one will securely hold any phone in place on a bike's handlebars, and it's adjustable (on both angle and tilt) so he can always see it.  100 Movies Scratch-Off Poster Best for the film bro Lights, camera, action! Help the would-be film bro in your life watch 100 iconic films with this bucket list scratch-off poster. Under each movie, there's a fun film-related piece of art. A Pink Miracle shoe cleaner kit Best for the sneakerhead If his sneaker collection is precious to him, this well-rated kit will make a great present. The Pink Miracle shoe cleaner has been tackling the dirtiest soles since 1985, making it a classic in the sneakerhead community. One bottle will last him years.  An Apple TV 4K Best for the guy who's seen everything He’s bored of Netflix. Seen everything on Hulu. What now? Introduce him to Apple TV+. A free three-month trial of the streaming service (which has some of the hottest TV and films around — hi, Ted Lasso) is included with your purchase of the latest Apple TV 4K. The sleek media player features a new and improved Siri remote for voice control as well as Dolby Atmos support for immersive, theater-worthy audio. A cocktail smoker Best for the at-home mixologist His at-home bar already has all the expected touches: a strainer, whiskey stones, fun glassware. But does he have a smoker? Help him recreate the experience of a drink at one of his favorite bars with this handheld smoker that will add a woodsy flair to his cocktails.  Living Composter Best for the eco warrior This composter can compost over two pounds of food a week with the help of its hardworking worms. (Sadly, the worms are not included.) It makes a great gift for the environmentalist with an eye for design. A cozy wool slipper Best for the guy with chilly feet The perfect house shoe, this classic wool felt slipper is easy to slip on and off. It’s available in a variety of color choices and with leather or rubber soles. Each pair is hand-crafted by artisans in Nepal, using ethically sourced 100% New Zealand wool. A smart toothbrush Best for the guy who's always smiling If you know a guy who’s always showing off his pearly whites, give him a toothbrush that can help him put his best face forward. This model features a choice of five different smart modes that clean, whiten, massage, and polish teeth. The sleek black design adds a pop of elegance to his vanity, and it includes a travel case for when he’s on the road. King C. Gillette beard grooming kit Best for bearded men There are a lot of beard grooming kits on Amazon, and we can tell you from experience that most of them are definitely not worthy of your man. King C. Gillette is the exception. Named for the Gillette founder and namesake, this collection of award-winning beard products helps guys keep their facial hair in tip-top shape. A Lodge "Yellowstone" edition cast-iron skillet Best for Yellowstone fans The smash-hit TV show "Yellowstone" stars the iconic Kevin Costner. If there are any dudes on your holiday shopping list who love this show as much as they love bacon, then we have the perfect gift idea — a limited-edition cast-iron skillet inspired by the show's Dutton Ranch. Heavy-duty fireplace tongs Best for fire pit masters Have you watched a guy fiddle with a fire pit or bonfire for hours on end? Some people just can't resist tinkering with the logs until they're just right. Perfect for fire pits, fireplaces, and open flames, these metal tongs will keep the fun going as long as there's fuel to burn. A portable power station Best for gadget guys You don't have to be a Boy Scout to understand the importance of being prepared. (Do they even make Boy Scouts anymore?) Once it's charged, the Jackery Explorer makes sure that you have enough juice for phones, laptops, drones, and anything else you want to plug in on a camping or road trip. A new game for the PS5 Best for Playstation players The recently released "Marvel's Spider-Man 2" has already proven to be a huge hit among gamers. In this game, he can play as Peter Parker, Miles Morales, and even more characters. Just check to make sure he hasn't played this through three times already. A Bluetooth speaker Best for music lovers When we've conducted blind sound tests, JBL speakers have beaten out the likes of Sonos and Bose. The brand's portable speakers offer big, balanced sound, and the ultra-compact Go 3 is fully waterproof. It also boasts hours of playtime before it needs a recharge. A smart digital picture frame Best gift for dads We know your old man is hard to shop for, and that's why a digital picture frame is one of our favorite gifts for him. The Skylight will remind dad of his favorite memories and help him keep up with what his kids and grandkids are doing. You can preload this smart frame with photos, and the whole family can add new photos via email. A stand for his headphones Best for WFH warriors Sometimes, the best gifts for men are simple and practical. For gamers and remote workers, these universal headphone stands will help him organize his desktop and show off his cans. And unlike a lot of similar products, anti-slip pads on the base keep it from toppling over. Athleisure from adidas Best for chill dudes Nothing says love like a cozy pair of pants with a matching zip-up. Enter: the Adidas tracksuit. A highly-coveted athleisure staple, these coordinating pants and jackets come in a variety of colors and will look just as at home on the field as they do on the couch. Dylan Haas is a Lead Shopping Reporter for Mashable, where he covers all things gaming, pets, fitness, sleep, and shopping events like Black Friday and Prime Day. Before joining the team at Mashable, Dylan received a B.A. in Communications from Pace University and contributed to publications like Paste Magazine, Bandsintown, and others following a brief stint as a marketing and management assistant in the music industry. When he's not writing or testing products, you can find Dylan playing lots of video games, working out, spending time with loved ones (especially his dog, Stevie), or watching reality TV. Basically the Netflix of gaming, Xbox Game Pass has an extended library of titles, including both new releases and classics, to download at any time. It's also suspiciously cheap for the value, but we aren't complaining. 

A VNYL subscription

Best for the music nerd

If his Spotify membership isn't doing it for him, treat him to a vinyl subscription service. VNYL will send brand new records to members each month based on their personal music tastes, making it a wonderful way to discover obscure artists and your new favorite track. (Just make sure he has a record player, first.)

A HyperChiller

Best for iced coffee enthusiasts

Who doesn’t love a good iced coffee? The HyperChiller is a delightful (and dishwasher-safe) beverage chiller that turns piping hot coffee into refreshing iced coffee in about a minute, and without diluting it. It also works for whiskey, bottles of wine, and tea. 

The Courant Catch:3 wireless charging tray

Best for the messy man

If his nightstand is looking totally out of sorts, the Courant Catch:3 should get him back on track (though we can't speak for the rest of his room). It isn't just a catch-all tray for jewelry, keys, and other items of the like — it's also a wireless charging mat that works on any nightstand.

The Byrd Hairdo Products Flock Favorites kit

Best for guys who love their hair

If his hair routine is an important part of his daily grooming ritual, Byrd makes a fantastic haircare set that covers the essentials. It comes with a canister of matte pomade, a texturizing salt spray, a pocket comb, and an air freshener as a fun little extra something. 

The Bearaby Cotton Napper weighted blanket

Best for the anxious guy

Weighted blankets are all the rage right now, but what sets Bearaby's Napper apart is that it's fully hand-knit, which should help minimize bead leakage. It's also machine washable.

Birkenstock Boston Clog

Best for the guy who hates shoelaces

Sometimes laces are nothing more than a chore. If he's most concerned with comfort, the Birkenstock Boston Clogs come with a form-fitting footbed that's excellent for extended wear. Plus, they're really popular on TikTok, so extra cool points for that.

A Mejuri mini hoop earring

Best for the guy who likes jewelry

If he appreciates a little understated bling in his daily getup, these mini hoop earrings from Mejuri should complement his personal style nicely. They come in both white and yellow gold; we recommend picking up one of each for when he wants to switch things up. (They're true 14-karat gold, too, meaning they won't oxidize or discolor — a great value for $30.)  

A pair of Carhartt double-front washed duck work pants

Best for the guy who's on-trend

Carhartt work pants have officially left the "dads only" category. These have a comfortable, loose fit that sits high on the waist, plenty of pockets, and cool knee-pad detailing on the front. Time to hop on the bandwagon. 

The Brooklinen Super-Plush Robe

Best for the homebody

Every guy needs a good robe, by which we mean an investment that will last, not fall apart in the wash. Brooklinen's Super-Plush Robe will ensure that his homebody self is feeling comfortable and luxurious at all times. Plus, it's seriously soft.

A Dodow sleep aid

Best for the restless guy

Not everyone sleeps like a baby. Some of us need a little extra help to catch some of those much-needed Zs. If you know a guy who has trouble getting to sleep at night, check out the Dodow sleep aid device: a metronome system designed to help you fall asleep naturally.

A Menlo Club subscription

Best for the fashion newbie

If the man in your life has zero fashion sense, then a monthly subscription to Menlo Club makes a great gift. For $60 a month, subscribers will receive two or three curated items in the mail to keep, ranging from casual clothes like T-shirts and jeans to activewear like running shorts and tank tops.

A Loot Crate subscription

Best for geeky guys

If the man in your life is a comic book nerd, a Loot Crate membership is a must-have. Once a month, the pop culture subscription service will send a mystery box full of products, toys, T-shirts, socks, and more right to his doorstep. The best part: Most of the items sent are exclusives or limited editions.

A pour-over coffee maker

Best for coffee lovers

The Chemex Classic Series Pour-Over Glass Coffeemaker looks gorgeous on a countertop and makes for a lovely gift for even the snobbiest of coffee snobs. This option makes eight cups and can be refrigerated and reheated without the coffee getting gross.

The Cubii under-desk elliptical

Best for the multitasker

If you've ever heard him complain that he simply doesn't have enough time to go to the gym, give him this creative way to multitask. The Cubii Under Desk Elliptical will allow him to work out while he's working — who needs an Equinox membership, anyway?

A Hydro Flask

Best for the hydrated dude

One of the most popular insulated water bottles on the market, a Hydro Flask is one of the best ways to ensure that he stays hydrated in style. It's capable of keeping hot drinks hot for up to 12 hours, and cold drinks cold for an entire day. Plus, a wide opening and a straw lid allow for easy beverage access. Did we mention it's all dishwasher-safe?

A Braun electric shaver

Best for men who need a close shave

If you know someone who wants to ditch their razor blades and shaving cream in favor of electric razors, the Braun Electric Shaver Series 9 should be at the top of your list. The Series 9 is a superb electric shaver that is also gentle on the face — two very important qualities. It's expensive, yes, but oh-so worth it.

An Ember mug

Best for the tea sipper

Here's the tea: The Ember mug is a truly next-level product for any and all hot-beverage-drinking guys. Through Ember's app, he'll have the ability to select his preferred temperature, to which the mug will adjust on command. Just one charge will give the mug a whole hour of juice, and he can even save temperature presets for different types of drinks. 

Amazon's favorite sous vide

Best for the aspiring chef

We're past the age of grilled steaks — it's all about sous vide nowadays. While it takes longer and is a more involved process, the result is dangerously delicious, which is why it's a great gift for the foodie fellas. This WiFi-enabled sous vide tool from Amazon best-seller Anova is one of the sleekest, most compact options out there, and it makes the process simple for newbies.

The Awair Element

Best for the health-conscious

Maintaining a safe and healthy home starts with good air quality. Enter: the Awair Element, a modern-looking monitoring device that measures and tracks fine dust particles and any chemicals present in the air. He'll be able to access real-time data and personalized recommendations on its companion app, including insights on how his actions (like the cleaning supplies he uses) are impacting the health of his space.

A Tooletries shower organizer

Best for the disorganized dude

Put an end to bathroom clutter and help him get his self-care life together with this shower organizer from Tooletries. It fits a toothbrush, razor, and all the little fixings that come along with them. Stick it anywhere in the shower and it's ready to go — you can even pick up the shower mirror from Tooletries and complete the set. 

The Jack Black Skin Saviors set

Best for the self-care obsessed

Guys need a proper skincare routine, too, and this set from Jack Black (no, not that Jack Black) is a great start. It includes a daily facial cleanser, an energizing exfoliator, a double-duty moisturizer, and an intense therapy lip balm. Whether he needs a new routine or is already skincare-obsessed, this set is a great option.

A 23andMe DNA test kit

Best for the curious guy

23andMe is a super popular gift every year, in part due to its convenience. Once he gets the kit, all he'll need to do is send in a small sample of saliva to 23andMe. In roughly three to four weeks, he'll get a comprehensive report of his ancestry, including precise geographic detail and in-depth historical insights, as well as a breakdown of his defining genetic traits.

A Kindle Paperwhite

Best for the bookworm

This thin, lightweight, and long-lasting e-reader has a glare-free display, which helps its screen look like real paper even in direct sunlight. It's waterproof, too, meaning he'll be able to take it out by the pool (or even on a beach trip), and an adjustable warm light keeps it easy on his eyes. Plus, it comes with a free four-month trial of Kindle Unlimited — in case he's already plowed through his library and needs something new to read.

Ray-Ban Wayfarer sunglasses

Best for the classic man

These sunglasses are a timeless classic. If your recipient has some retro taste in fashion but still wants to keep his accessories trend-proof, these shades will help him achieve the effortless style he's looking for. They really look good with everything, from workout clothes to formalwear.

Felix Gray glasses

Best for dealing with eye strain

If the man you're shopping for stares at a screen all day, snag him a pair of these stylish, blue light-blocking glasses to give his peepers some much-needed relief. They'll filter out the harmful blue-violet light rays commonly emitted from digital devices, which can lead to eye strain, headaches, and sleep disruption.

A personalized cutting board

Best for the culinary king

Most people have a cutting board — but not a cutting board with their name literally carved into it. This handcrafted maple cutting board can be customized with up to 12 characters and will make a lovely accent piece in his kitchen. Add a bottle of mineral oil for $9 to help it last for years to come.

A Tile Pro Bluetooth tracker

Best for the forgetful man

If he's the type of guy to leave his keys at home or his wallet in random coffee shops, the small but endlessly helpful Tile Pro is here to solve his problems. Simply attach one of the fobs to frequently misplaced items, then use the Tile app to locate them locate via smartphone.

An Otterbox phone case

Best for the clumsy guy

Know a guy who's dropping his phone constantly? Get him an Otterbox case. This one is part of the "Commuter" series, and it's designed to handle whatever screen-shattering threats may come your guy's way. For the slightly ham-handed man in your life, this is perfect for everyday use. 

A Yeti Rambler Colster

Best for beer bros

Let's be honest: No one likes room-temperature beer. Keep his brews nice and chilly with this Yeti Rambler Colster can insulator. The no-sweat design will keep his hands dry, while the load-and-lock gasket ensures his drink is tucked in securely. It's a fancy, attractive, and practical solution.

A Google Nest Hub

Best for the smart home lover

Is his home decked out in smart devices, like Philips Hue bulbs and a Nest thermostat? The second-gen Google Nest Hub will serve as a one-stop shop for all of his smart device controls, making it much easier for him to interact with his fully connected home. Beyond that, he can also use it to catch up on his Netflix queue, listen to music, and even get a better night's sleep (with the help of its Sleep Sensing tool).

A Theragun Mini

Best for fitness fanatics

After long runs or intense workouts, pretty much everyone wishes they could get a massage. The compact, quiet Theragun Mini is basically the next best thing. Even though it's small enough to toss in a bag, the powerful device will give him a good-enough muscle massage to kickstart his recovery.

The FosPower solar hand crank portable radio

Best for the outdoorsman

He doesn’t play by the rules. Sure, some people sleep at campsites when they want a touch of nature. But not him. He’s going way off the beaten path. Help him stay safe while forging his own way through nature with this solar-powered, hand-crank portable radio/phone charger/lamp.

Powerbeats Pro wireless earbuds

Best for the runner

Some people march to the beat of their own drum; others run to a heavy bass beat. No matter what he’s listening to while he's out pounding the pavement, these earbuds deliver excellent audio quality — and they won’t fall out no matter how much he moves. 

A Ninja BL610 professional blender

Best for the smoothie king

If he’s constantly making smoothies, give him a gift he’ll actually use. This top-rated blender will whip up the smoothest drinks from fresh fruits and vegetables in seconds. (It also crushes ice and frozen fruit.) And if he’s not super into health drinks, tell him he's free to use it to make margaritas instead.

A bike phone mount

Best for the cyclist

If his Trek is his main mode of transportation around town, he’ll appreciate a phone mount when he’s navigating to a new location. This one will securely hold any phone in place on a bike's handlebars, and it's adjustable (on both angle and tilt) so he can always see it. 

100 Movies Scratch-Off Poster

Best for the film bro

Lights, camera, action! Help the would-be film bro in your life watch 100 iconic films with this bucket list scratch-off poster. Under each movie, there's a fun film-related piece of art.

A Pink Miracle shoe cleaner kit

Best for the sneakerhead

If his sneaker collection is precious to him, this well-rated kit will make a great present. The Pink Miracle shoe cleaner has been tackling the dirtiest soles since 1985, making it a classic in the sneakerhead community. One bottle will last him years. 

An Apple TV 4K

Best for the guy who's seen everything

He’s bored of Netflix. Seen everything on Hulu. What now? Introduce him to Apple TV+. A free three-month trial of the streaming service (which has some of the hottest TV and films around — hi, Ted Lasso) is included with your purchase of the latest Apple TV 4K. The sleek media player features a new and improved Siri remote for voice control as well as Dolby Atmos support for immersive, theater-worthy audio.

A cocktail smoker

Best for the at-home mixologist

His at-home bar already has all the expected touches: a strainer, whiskey stones, fun glassware. But does he have a smoker? Help him recreate the experience of a drink at one of his favorite bars with this handheld smoker that will add a woodsy flair to his cocktails. 

Living Composter

Best for the eco warrior

This composter can compost over two pounds of food a week with the help of its hardworking worms. (Sadly, the worms are not included.) It makes a great gift for the environmentalist with an eye for design.

A cozy wool slipper

Best for the guy with chilly feet

The perfect house shoe, this classic wool felt slipper is easy to slip on and off. It’s available in a variety of color choices and with leather or rubber soles. Each pair is hand-crafted by artisans in Nepal, using ethically sourced 100% New Zealand wool.

A smart toothbrush

Best for the guy who's always smiling

If you know a guy who’s always showing off his pearly whites, give him a toothbrush that can help him put his best face forward. This model features a choice of five different smart modes that clean, whiten, massage, and polish teeth. The sleek black design adds a pop of elegance to his vanity, and it includes a travel case for when he’s on the road.

King C. Gillette beard grooming kit

Best for bearded men

There are a lot of beard grooming kits on Amazon, and we can tell you from experience that most of them are definitely not worthy of your man. King C. Gillette is the exception. Named for the Gillette founder and namesake, this collection of award-winning beard products helps guys keep their facial hair in tip-top shape.

A Lodge "Yellowstone" edition cast-iron skillet

Best for Yellowstone fans

The smash-hit TV show "Yellowstone" stars the iconic Kevin Costner. If there are any dudes on your holiday shopping list who love this show as much as they love bacon, then we have the perfect gift idea — a limited-edition cast-iron skillet inspired by the show's Dutton Ranch.

Heavy-duty fireplace tongs

Best for fire pit masters

Have you watched a guy fiddle with a fire pit or bonfire for hours on end? Some people just can't resist tinkering with the logs until they're just right. Perfect for fire pits, fireplaces, and open flames, these metal tongs will keep the fun going as long as there's fuel to burn.

A portable power station

Best for gadget guys

You don't have to be a Boy Scout to understand the importance of being prepared. (Do they even make Boy Scouts anymore?) Once it's charged, the Jackery Explorer makes sure that you have enough juice for phones, laptops, drones, and anything else you want to plug in on a camping or road trip.

A new game for the PS5

Best for Playstation players

The recently released "Marvel's Spider-Man 2" has already proven to be a huge hit among gamers. In this game, he can play as Peter Parker, Miles Morales, and even more characters. Just check to make sure he hasn't played this through three times already.

A Bluetooth speaker

Best for music lovers

When we've conducted blind sound tests, JBL speakers have beaten out the likes of Sonos and Bose. The brand's portable speakers offer big, balanced sound, and the ultra-compact Go 3 is fully waterproof. It also boasts hours of playtime before it needs a recharge.

A smart digital picture frame

Best gift for dads

We know your old man is hard to shop for, and that's why a digital picture frame is one of our favorite gifts for him. The Skylight will remind dad of his favorite memories and help him keep up with what his kids and grandkids are doing. You can preload this smart frame with photos, and the whole family can add new photos via email.

A stand for his headphones

Best for WFH warriors

Sometimes, the best gifts for men are simple and practical. For gamers and remote workers, these universal headphone stands will help him organize his desktop and show off his cans. And unlike a lot of similar products, anti-slip pads on the base keep it from toppling over.

Athleisure from adidas

Best for chill dudes

Nothing says love like a cozy pair of pants with a matching zip-up. Enter: the Adidas tracksuit. A highly-coveted athleisure staple, these coordinating pants and jackets come in a variety of colors and will look just as at home on the field as they do on the couch.
